Package rrpss

Class setPackage

java.lang.Object
rrpss.menuitem
rrpss.setPackage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<menuitem>
public class setPackage extends menuitem
Class to represent a Set Package in the menu. A set package is also a menuitem, hence it inherits its methods.
Author:
Siddhant Pathak
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • setPackage

      public setPackage​(menuitem.type itemtype, String name, String description, double price)
      Public Constructor to create a set package with the given information.
      Parameters:
      itemtype - Type of the menu item to be added
      name - Name of the set package
      description - Description of the set package
      price - Price of the set package

    • setPackage

      public setPackage​(menuitem.type itemtype, String name, String description, double price, ArrayList<menuitem> setPkgItems)
      Public Constructor to create a set package with the given information
      Parameters:
      itemtype - Type of the menu item to be added
      name - Name of the set package
      description - Description of the set package
      price - Price of the set package
      setPkgItems - The list of set package items (if exists)

      Checks if the set package is empty or not
      Returns:

      public void recalculatePackagePrice()

    • findInPackage

      public boolean findInPackage​(menuitem menuItem)
      Checks if this set package contains the specified menu item
      Parameters:
      menuItem - The menu item to look for in this set package
      Returns:
      True if this menu item can be found in the set package

    • showPackage

      public void showPackage()
      Shows the necessary details of a set package. Prints the name, description and price of the set package.
